text: Géza Kiss (22 October 1882 – 23 August 1952) was a Hungarian freestyle swimmer who competed in the 1904 Summer Olympics and 1906 Intercalated Games. In the 1904 Olympics he won a silver medal in the 1 mile freestyle and a bronze medal in the 880 yard freestyle. Two years later, at the Intercalated Games, he won a gold medal as a member of Hungarian 4×250 m freestyle relay. == References == * Category:1882 births Category:1952 deaths Category:Hungarian male swimmers Category:Male freestyle swimmers Category:Olympic silver medalists for Hungary Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Hungary Category:Olympic swimmers of Hungary Category:Olympic bronze medalists in swimming Category:Medalists at the 1904 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1906 Intercalated Games Category:Swimmers at the 1904 Summer Olympics Category:Swimmers at the 1906 Intercalated Games Category:People from Borsod- Abaúj-Zemplén County Category:Olympic silver medalists in swimming
title: Géza Kiss
